lines.text: I beg you, apologize to Odette. You know you're going to have to sooner or later.
Why do I always have to be the one to apologize?
Because that's what we husbands do. We hunt, we fish, we watch sporting events and we apologize.
You know she's right. She's always right.
I still don't like my options.
Oh, sure, let the frog drive. Frogs are known for their wagon driving.
Rogers, this is your queen speaking. You will regain consciousness this instant, and remain conscious until I win the talent show.
Very well. I have no other choice but to take you to my castle and deal with you in a manner to which you are according.
Oh, my muffin played the accordion.
You are so brave. So handsome, too. Even the nose. Long, like jumbo frankfurter.
How could she leave me? We were in love. Wait, maybe I misunderstood her letter. Yes, that's it.
